description.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"States must stop criminalizing poverty and start using treatment, community investments, and social supports to address social problems.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

richText.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"heading-3","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"The United States makes it a crime to be poor. ","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"paragraph","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"We jail people over unpaid debts. We keep people on probation because they cannot pay off their fines. We fine and jail persons experiencing homelessness for basic, life-sustaining activities like sleeping and sheltering themselves. We suspend and revoke driver’s licenses for unpaid fees and fines, making it impossible for nearly 7 million people to conduct their daily lives — to work, see the doctor, buy groceries, visit family, pick up and take care of children, and even to leave the house. And we deny voting rights to people who cannot pay criminal-legal debts.","marks":[],"data":{}}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"paragraph","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"This practice of criminalizing poverty disproportionately affects Black, Brown, LGBTQIA+, and low-income communities and turns jails into debtors’ prisons where poor people are incarcerated simply for being poor. Criminalizing poverty prevents families from thriving by exacerbating challenges low-income people already face. Incarceration lowers employment rates, destroys family relationships, triggers housing insecurity, and makes economic stability even more difficult to attain.","marks":[],"data":{}}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"paragraph","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Decriminalizing poverty is a necessary step toward building a world where we invest in low-income communities and ensure every community has the tools it needs to thrive. It’s time we take this step.","marks":[],"data":{}}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"paragraph","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Read our policy recommendations.","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}],"data":{}}]}

content.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"heading-4","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Abolish fees and costs from the juvenile and adult criminal-legal processes.","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"paragraph","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"","marks":[],"data":{}}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"paragraph","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"","marks":[],"data":{}}],"data":{}}]}

{"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"heading-4","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Require jurisdictions to offer non-carceral responses, such as free, need-based, and non-coercive social supports, for behaviors that are caused by poverty, mental health disabilities, trauma, or substance use.","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"paragraph","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"","marks":[],"data":{}}],"data":{}}]}

{"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"heading-4","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Prohibit incarceration, the extension of probation terms, voting restrictions, and driver’s license suspension for unpaid debts. ","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"paragraph","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"","marks":[],"data":{}}],"data":{}}]}

promo1.title: Ensure accountability and transparency in prosecution

text.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"We must create a system that is fair, transparent, and accountable. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"We must build a system where people returning from prison have access to non-punitive, community-based supports.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}
